intro: Oenanthe biebersteinii f. montana, commonly known as the mountain water dropwort, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes plants like carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to greenish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, rocky habitats and is often found in alpine environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
